snippet: The three men were conspiring to illegally export carbon fiber, sometimes used to make machines that can enrich uranium, which can be used as fuel for nuclear reactors and atom bombs.
abstract: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan charge Hamid Reza Hashemi, Peter Gromacki, Amir Abbas Tamimi and Murat Taskiran with conspiring to illegally export carbon fiber from the United States to Iran and China; carbon fiber is sometimes used to make machines that can enrich uranium, which can be used as fuel for nuclear reactors and atom bombs.
lead_paragraph: The three men were conspiring to illegally export carbon fiber, sometimes used to make machines that can enrich uranium, which can be used as fuel for nuclear reactors and atom bombs.

headline.seo: 3 Charged With Plotting to Export Carbon Fiber to Iran
headline.main: 3 Charged With Plotting to Export Sensitive Materials to Iran and China
headline.print_headline: 3 Charged With Plotting to Export Sensitive Materials to Iran and China
